name: My Awesome Project
tagline: A brief, catchy description of what this project does
description:
This is where you tell the story of your project. What problem did it solve? What was interesting about building it? What did you learn? Make it conversational and engaging - people want to understand not just what you built, but why and how.

You can use multiple paragraphs to tell a complete story. Talk about your motivations, the challenges you faced, and the impact it had.
role: Describe your specific role in this project. Were you the solo developer? Did you lead a team? What parts did you focus on? Be specific about your contributions.
problem: What problem were you trying to solve? Make this relatable - help readers understand why this project mattered and why someone would care about the solution.
approach: How did you approach solving this problem? What was your methodology? What tools or frameworks did you choose and why?
challenges: What obstacles did you face while building this? Technical challenges, design decisions, performance issues? How did you overcome them?
keyFeatures: List the main features or capabilities
Focus on what makes this project special
Keep each point concise but descriptive
techStack: React, Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Node.js
outcomes: What was the result? Did users love it? Did you learn something valuable? Any metrics or feedback you can share? What impact did this project have?

name: Another Cool Project
tagline: Different type of project with different features
description: Here's an example of a different kind of project. Maybe this one has audio files, or documents, or videos. The structure is flexible to accommodate different types of work.
